summary.para: Contains information about processor performance control and C-states.
The current structure revision level. Set this value by calling before using a PROCESSOR_POWER_POLICY structure to set power policy.
The current processor performance state policy. This member must be one of the values described in Processor Performance Control Policy Constants.
The number of elements in the Policy array.

An array of structures that defines values used to apply processor C-state policy settings. Policy[0] corresponds to ACPI C-state C1, Policy[1] corresponds to C2, and Policy[2] corresponds to C3. The AllowPromotion member determines whether the processor can be promoted to the state. For example, if Policy[0].AllowPromotion is 0, the computer cannot transition from C0 to C1.
